application.name: InstaEclipse
application.summary: An Instagram enhancer module with features like Developer Options, Ghost Mode...
application.desc:
InstaEclipse âš¡ Enhance Your Instagram Experience!

InstaEclipse is an LSPosed module designed to enhance your Instagram experience with advanced features like developer options, ghost mode, distraction-free mode, and more! ğŸš€

This module is built to stay compatible with new Instagram releases by leveraging dynamic analysis to locate targeted classes and methods automatically. ğŸ§ âœ¨

âœ¨ Features

ğŸ›ï¸ Developer Options

  • Access hidden developer tools within Instagram for advanced functionality.
  • Note: These options are intended for use with Alpha or Beta versions of Instagram.

ğŸ‘» Ghost Mode

  • Stay incognito while browsing stories, lives, or DMs.

ğŸ§˜ Distraction-Free Mode

  • Enjoy Instagram without stories, reels, or explore feed distractions.
  • Important: After enabling Distraction-Free Mode:
    1. Force stop Instagram.
    2. Clear Instagramâ€™s cache.
    3. Launch Instagram for a clean experience.

ğŸš« Remove Ads

  • Removes most of Instagramâ€™s app ads (excluding feed ads).

ğŸ“‰ Remove Analytics

  • Block Instagramâ€™s tracking and analytics to protect your privacy.
  • Prevent unnecessary data sharing and usage metrics.

ğŸ”§ Misc Options

  • Disable Auto Story Flipping.
  • Disable Auto Play Videos.

ğŸ› ï¸ Installation Instructions

âš ï¸ Install Instagram from APKMirror, as the module doesnâ€™t fully support Google Play Store versions yet!

1ï¸âƒ£ Install the Module

  • Download and install the InstaEclipse APK. You can find the latest release here.

2ï¸âƒ£ Enable the Module in LSPosed

âš ï¸ Make sure you are using the latest LSPosed Fork by JingMatrix.

  • Open the LSPosed Manager.
  • Enable the InstaEclipse Module for the Instagram app.

3ï¸âƒ£ Open the Module

  • Launch InstaEclipse.

4ï¸âƒ£ Configure Your Features

  • Go to the Features Tab.
  • Select the features you want to enable or customize.
  • Save your preferences.

5ï¸âƒ£ Restart Instagram

  • Go back to the Home Tab in the InstaEclipse module.
  • Click Restart Instagram.

ğŸ“– FAQ

â“ Module not enabled?

Disable and re-enable the module in LSPosed.

â“ Features not working?

Force stop and restart Instagram.

â“ Developer options causing crashes?

Follow the provided instructions for developer options and ensure youâ€™re using Alpha or Beta versions of Instagram.

â“ Why are some labels obfuscated or numbered?

This is due to obfuscation in Stable versions of Instagram. Use Beta or Alpha versions to avoid this.

â“ Distraction-Free Mode enabled, but content still appears?

Force stop Instagram and clear its cache to apply the changes properly.

ğŸ“‚ Resources

  • ğŸ™ GitHub Repository: Explore InstaEclipse
  • ğŸ’¬ Support & Updates: Telegram Channel
  • âš™ï¸ LSPosed - Fork By JingMatrix LSPosed

ğŸ‰ Contributors

ğŸ‘‘ Project Owner

  • ReSo7200

ğŸ’¡ Contributors

  • frknkrc44

ğŸ™Œ Special Thanks

  • xHookman
  • AmÃ zing World
  • Bluepapilte (MyInsta Mod Owner) Telegram
  • BdrcnAYYDIN Telegram

ğŸŒ Translation Contributors

A heartfelt thank you to everyone who contributed to translating InstaEclipse into multiple languages. Your efforts help make the module accessible to users worldwide! ğŸŒŸ

ğŸ› ï¸ Powered By

  • JingMatrix/LSPosed, the foundation for module functionality.
  • LuckyPray/DexKit, enabling dynamic analysis for compatibility with new Instagram updates.

ğŸ’¡ Contributions

We welcome contributions from everyone!

  • Have an idea? Open an issue or submit a feature request.
  • Found a bug? Report it through our GitHub Issues.
  • Want to help? Submit a pull request to improve InstaEclipse.

Every contribution, big or small, is highly valued. Thank you for helping us grow!

application.name: MACsposed
application.summary: MACsposed - Add support for MAC Address spoofing to Android 12 through 15!
application.desc:
MACsposed

Historically, setting a custom MAC address on Android was very easy for rooted users. Starting with Android 12, however, Googleâ€™s implementation of MAC address randomization has made it impossible, as the MAC address is always changed when the network state is altered. If you have encountered this problem, then you need MACsposed! MACsposed is an Xposed module that blocks the MAC address randomizer on Android 12 through 15 and provides a user-friendly interface for spoofing your MAC address. Do you have other spoofing tools that you would prefer to use instead? No problem! Simply enable MACsposed and go back to using your preferred address spoofing tool.

MACsposed is not free software and requires an in-app purchase of a subscription or a lifetime license to unlock its functionality.

âš ï¸ WARNING: MACsposed is intended for rooted devices running Android 12 through 15 and requires Xposed. The required Xposed variant to use is LSPosed. Other Xposed variants will not work. Additionally, this module cannot be guaranteed to work on all devices. In the worst case, it can cause a bootloop. Use at your own risk.

application.name: Volume Key Track Control Module
application.desc:
Volume Key Track Control Module

An Xposed module that allows to skip and play/pause track with volume keys. Inspired by Gravity Box.

Usage

Works when the screen is off.

  • Next Track: Long press volume up
  • Prev Track: Long press volume down
  • Play/Pause: Long press both keys simultaneously

Requirements

  • LSPosed 93+
  • Android 11+ (may be working on lower versions, you can try and install it even on Android 8.1)

Tested on

  • OnePlus 10 Pro (Android 13 & 14)

Open an issue if you are experiencing some troubles on your device
